name: <sys::process::unix::unix::ExitStatus as core::fmt::Display>::fmt

sys::process::unix::unix::signal_string.doc:
Converts a signal number to a readable, searchable name.

 This string should be displayed right after the signal number.
 If a signal is unrecognized, it returns the empty string, so that
 you just get the number like "0". If it is recognized, you'll get
 something like "9 (SIGKILL)".

core::fmt::Arguments::<'a>::from_str.doc:
Create a `fmt::Arguments` object for a single static string.

 Formatting this `fmt::Arguments` will just produce the string as-is.

core::option::Option: Unknown([Downcast(VariantIdx(1, ThreadLocalIndex)), Field(0, Ty { id: 44, kind: RigidTy(Int(I32)) })])
